definition[0]: the right to drive into or across a road before other vehicles
example[0]: I never know who has right of way at this junction.  British English
example[1]: The law here says that pedestrians always have the right of way.
definition[1]: the right to walk across someone elseâ€™s land
example[2]: Walkers are often quite aggressive about their rights of way.
definition[2]: a path that people have the right to use
example[3]: The path is not a public right of way.
definition[3]: the legal right to pass across land that does not belong to you
example[4]: The court said California must pay compensation in exchange for a public right of way over beachfront property.
